definition[0]: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose
example[0]: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.
example[1]: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
example[2]: The standard of his work is barely adequate.
example[3]: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
example[4]: Are the parking facilities adequate for 50 cars?
example[5]: The lunchtime menu is more than adequate to satisfy the biggest appetite.
example[6]: Her performance was adequate but lacked originality.
